panels.description: The reconciliation rate is calculated by measuring the change in value between consecutive scrape intervals and dividing by the duration of the interval. For example, if the rate is 0.066 and the scrape interval is 30 seconds, it indicates that 2 reconciliations occurred during that interval (2 รท 30 = 0.066)
panels.title: Reconciliation Rate
Count of Existing RayClusters in Namespaces

panels.description: Shows the time (in seconds) it took each RayCluster to become provisioned, grouped by name, namespace, and owner type.
panels.title: Provisioned Duration

panels.description: Displays RayClusters in the selected namespace(s) that have not yet been provisioned (RayClusterProvisioned = false).
panels.title: RayClusterProvisioned (false)

panels.description: Displays RayCluster head pods that are not ready.

targets.expr: kube_pod_status_ready{condition="false", namespace=~"$namespace"} == 1 and on(pod) kube_pod_info{created_by_kind="RayCluster", pod=~".*-head", namespace=~"$namespace"}

panels.title: HeadPodReady (false)
Count of Existing RayClusters in Namespaces

panels.description: Displays RayServices in the selected namespace(s) that have not yet been ready (RayServiceReady = false).
panels.title: RayServiceReady (false)

panels.description: Displays RayServices in the selected namespace(s) that are currently performing a zero-downtime upgrade (UpgradeInProgress  = false)..
panels.title: UpgradeInProgress (true)
Count of Existing RayJobs in Namespaces

panels.description: Execution duration of all RayJobs, including those that have been deleted.
panels.title: Execution Duration
Deployment Status (Failed / Suspending / Suspended / Retrying / Waiting)
